question.text: In the production of the test-tube baby,

options.text: fertilization is internal and development is external.
fertilization is external and development is internal.

solution.text: Test tube babies are conceived outside a woman's body in a laboratory through the process called IVF. Test tube baby is a simplified terminology for baby through IVF. In this process, the woman has prescribed fertility drugs which stimulate the development of eggs, which are then removed from the ovaries once matured. These eggs are then combined with the sperm and transferred to a petri dish for fertilization into an embryo. The healthiest of the produced embryos are injected to the intended mother's uterus.
